descript.abstract: Bicycle Lanes. The dataset contains locations and attributes of both existing and proposed bicycle lanes based upon the DC Bicycle Master Plan. These are not bicycle trails. Created as part of the District of Columbia, Department of Transportation (DDOT) Street Spatial Database (SSD)
descript.supplinf: This dataset is the line geometry that represents Bicycle Lanes.

attr.attrdef: Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Shared Lane - These are roads that are not wide enough for bike lanes; they contain a bike symbol and chevron in the travel lane indicating that cars and bikes must share this space. Bike Lane – bike lane on both sides of a two-way road; one side on a one-way road. Climbing Lane –same as a bike lane; the difference is that there is a bike lane on the uphill side of the road, and a shared lane on the downhill side. Cycle Track – This is a buffer and/or post separated bike lane (15th St, PA Ave, and L St are the only ones right now). Neighborhood Bikeway – low-volume and low-speed streets that have been optimized for bicycle travel through treatments such as traffic calming, way-finding signage and pavement markings.
Combination of the street centerline and bike facility.
